data.text:
ð¤

Maragheh is relatively affordable compared to other Iranian cities, but prices for goods and services are still higher than what a visiting cat might expect. However, bargaining is common and can lead to good deals.

Haggle at the bazaar for souvenirs and spices. Hit the local bakeries for fresh bread at low cost.

Off the beaten path

ð®

Natar Pyramid

A bizarre structure that locals believe is a pre-Islamic Zoroastrian fire temple, though its real purpose is unknown. A mysterious place that beckons to adventurous cats. ð

Google Maps

ð§

Maragheh Ice House

Underground ice chamber built in the 18th century to store ice during summer. Remarkable for its sustainable technology and cool atmosphere, both literally and figuratively. âï¸

Google Maps

ð¾

Maragheh Castle

A centuries-old castle with steep walls, towers and domes, offering a panoramic view of the city. A great place to feel like a mighty feline warrior. ð°

Google Maps

ð­

Old Observatory

Astronomical observatory built in the 13th century, with a unique architecture that blends Iranian and Islamic styles. Perfect for curious cats who love to stargaze. ð

Google Maps

ðª¦

Maqbaratoshoara Cemetery

Final resting place of famous Persian poets like Khaghani and Anvari. Lush trees and soothing silence make it a peaceful spot for cat contemplation. ðï¸
